intro: Ophiorrhiza wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It is a small shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. The plant has distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and produces yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, hairy seeds. Ophiorrhiza wallichii is adapted to wet conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
